error.signature: Error: Resource already managed by Terraform or import ID not found
error.regex: (Resource already managed|import .+ (not found|failed)|Cannot import .+ into|resource .+ already exists in state)

verdict.summary: Terraform import failed because the resource already exists in state or the import ID format is incorrect.

dead_ends.action: Delete the real resource and recreate it with Terraform
dead_ends.why_fails: Deleting production resources causes downtime; import exists specifically to avoid this

dead_ends.action: Force-push a new state file to overwrite the existing resource entry
dead_ends.why_fails: Overwriting state can cause other resources to become orphaned or duplicated

workarounds.action: Use terraform state rm to remove stale state entry before re-importing
workarounds.how: terraform state rm MODULE.RESOURCE_ADDRESS, then terraform import MODULE.RESOURCE_ADDRESS RESOURCE_ID

workarounds.action: Use the import block in Terraform 1.5+ for declarative imports
workarounds.how: Add import { to = RESOURCE_ADDRESS; id = "RESOURCE_ID" } block and run terraform plan

leads_to.condition: After import, plan shows resource already exists in the cloud

preceded_by.condition: Resource created outside Terraform needs to be imported

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Resource already managed means it is in state already; import resource exists means the import process itself fails
